div.p: [Miss] M. L. Wigan to Mr Rodda
Field Naturalists' Club of Victoria archives, Melbourne.

Through the courtesy of the Director of Kew Gardens I had access to the Herbarium & met there Mr Summer Hayes who is in charge of the Australian section. He is a splendid man full of enthusiasm & knowledge which he is only too willing to impart. He impressed on me the value of the Baron Von Mueller collection in Melbourne & said we have some of the original specimens here which were sent out by Mr George Bentham & not returned. Mr Summerhayes is most anxious to obtain a new collection of the Victorian Flora. He told me there had been no decent collection since 1860 — nothing recent —
